Single Sign-On

The administrator can configure Serena ChangeMan Version Manager projects and project databases to recognize a user who has already logged in to Version Manager or another Serena application. When single sign-on is enabled, a user can login once and access all single sign-on enabled projects without logging in again--as long as they have an active license from the Serena License Manager. If single sign-on is also enabled in other Serena applications, the user is not required to log in again when switching between Serena applications.

You can enable single sign-on from the Login Sources pane of the Configure Project dialog box.

NOTE To use single sign-on, your Version Manager user ID and O/S user ID must match.

Troubleshooting

Single sign-on works in conjunction with FLEXlm licensing. If you experience problems with single sign-on, check the licensing configuration. For information on licensing and FLEXlm, see the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager Installation Guide.
